Class AV.SearchQuery


Defined in: av.js.

Class Summary
Constructor Attributes Constructor Name and Description
 
AV.SearchQuery()
App searching query.Use just like AV.Query: 

  var query = new AV.SearchQuery('Player');
  query.queryString('*');
  query.find().then(function(results) {
    console.log('Found %d objects', query.hits());
    //Process results
  });
Visite App Searching Guide for more details.
Method Summary
Method Attributes Method Name and Description
 
find(options)
Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy this query.
 
highlights(highlights)
Sets the highlight fields.
 
hits()
Returns the number of objects that match this query.
 
queryString(q)
Sets the query string of app searching.
 
sid(sid)
Sets the sid of app searching query.Default is null.
 
sortBy(builder)
Sets the sort builder for this query.
Class Detail
AV.SearchQuery()
App searching query.Use just like AV.Query: 

  var query = new AV.SearchQuery('Player');
  query.queryString('*');
  query.find().then(function(results) {
    console.log('Found %d objects', query.hits());
    //Process results
  });
Visite App Searching Guide for more details.
Since:
0.5.1
Method Detail
{AV.Promise} find(options)
Retrieves a list of AVObjects that satisfy this query. Either options.success or options.error is called when the find completes.
Parameters:
{Object} options
A Backbone-style options object.
Returns:
{AV.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when the query completes.
See:
AV.Query#find
{AV.SearchQuery} highlights(highlights)
Sets the highlight fields. Such as 

  query.highlights('title');
  //or pass an array.
  query.highlights(['title', 'content'])
Parameters:
{Array} highlights
a list of fields.
Returns:
{AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
{Number} hits()
Returns the number of objects that match this query.
Returns:
{Number}
{AV.SearchQuery} queryString(q)
Sets the query string of app searching.
Parameters:
{String} q
The query string.
Returns:
{AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
{AV.SearchQuery} sid(sid)
Sets the sid of app searching query.Default is null.
Parameters:
{String} sid
Scroll id for searching.
Returns:
{AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
{AV.SearchQuery} sortBy(builder)
Sets the sort builder for this query.
Parameters:
{AV.SearchSortBuilder} builder
The sort builder.
Returns:
{AV.SearchQuery} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
See:
AV.SearchSortBuilder
